column9: who was a stud for us this year

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/i-cant-be-mad-at-that/|“I Can’t Be Mad At That”|Bucs fans are still furious. And Joe doesn’t blame them one bit. Having typed that
column2: Joe doesn’t know what former Bucs offensive coordinator and new Jags head coach Liam Coen was supposed to do. Shad Con Khan allegedly waved $60 million (and some power to pick his general manager) in his face to keep his yap shut for 24 hours. Despite the ethical minefield that order from Con Khan put Coen in
column3: $60 million is $60 million. That can buy a lot of Plant City strawberries. That’s generations-changing money. If Coen can cobble together a couple of winning seasons in Jacksonville
column4: he may double that $60 million contract in the next decade with Con Khan. The guy who very easily could be damaged most by Coen leaving
column6: seems to see it the same way. Mayfield really wanted Coen back with the Bucs. But he told Joe’s good friend and local sports media icon Rock Riley yesterday at Pro Bowl practices that can’t blame Coen for taking the money and running to northeast Floria. “I know people are going to be upset by it
column9: you can’t argue with that decision. “I can’t be mad at that. As much as I would want to have him still here … life goes on and I’m happy for him.” Mayfield might be the guy with the most to lose without Coen around. It was Coen who helped save Mayfield in Los Angeles from the NFL scrap heap when the rest of the league gave up on him. Coen helped rescue Mayfield’s career. Then Mayfield came to the Bucs on a prove-it deal and 2023 Bucs offensive coordinator Dave Canales helped guide him to a career year — before Coen turned the Oklahoma product into one of the top quarterbacks in the league this season. If recent history holds

column160: ""post"": ""Baker is a top 5 quarterback in 2024 and will be the Bucs franchise quarterback for a long long time no matter the lies told about him. Top 5 out of all the quarterbacks in the league. He will do better on his mistakes in 2025 and will be the top 1 or 2. He loves the pressure of the playoffs and had the highest passer rating 136.5 out of all the quarterbacs at the end of the season and in the playoffs. Other quarterbacks just arent that good. Heck he took the worst team probably of all time from the previous 3 years of being drafted 4-44 and 0-16 the year before he was drafted to 11-5. Something no other quarterback had done before. He is about as elite as a quarterback can get. We are so lucky to have him. He took us when everybody Rod included said we would win 4 games to the playoffs and won. His completion percentage in 2024 of 71.4% was the highest by a quarterback so early in their career. Of course Rod said he wasn\u2019t accurate but as usual Baker IS the most accurate quarterback in the league in 2024. When the NFL wants to know how good a quarterback is they look at their passer rating. Baker in 2024 is basically tied for second. He is as elite as a quarterback can get. And to top it off he is so much fun to watch.""
